projects.title: Ebooks (informational, non fiction) for young children
projects.description: For use in my classes, I develop digital & interactive informational books for young children on various non-fiction, not-everyday themes like life at the Northpole, the use of camouflage and the foodchain in the jungle. They are audiobooks, suitable for gifted kindergartenkids (ages 3-6) as well as for older children with learning disabilities.

projects.title: Organisor of the Week of Russian Language and Culture
projects.description: The Week of Russian Language and Culture (27 t/m 30 november 2013) is organised by the Slavic Languages department of the University of Groningen (the Netherlands) in collaboration with the University of Tver (Russia) as part of the Dutch-Russian Friendshipyear 2013. It encompasses workshops, lectures and public cultural events (movies, exhibits, drama) for all interested in Russia, Russian language and Russian culture, be it students, professionals or others. I am part of the brainstorming team for the events and programs and I maintain the overview and planning of the entire organisation (including the multimedia and essay contests).

projects.title: Education author at STEDENBAND GRONINGEN-MOERMANSK
projects.description: Initiator and author of a collection of lessonplans about Russia for children in primary and secondary schools in the fields of geography, history, nature, cultures, arts & crafts, sports and language. The lessonplans can be used to work thematically from a Multiple Intelligent startingpoint, too. The lessons are preceeded by a section with general information and some highlights of Russia throughout the centuries, which has been edited by Lilian Eefting.

projects.title: Excavations at Groote Veen, Eelde
projects.description: On excavationsite of Groote Veen, Eelde (mainly iron and Roman ages), I have assisted the excavators in the field. Also, during open days, I have been a visitorsguide on site. Whenever there were children visiting, I tried to make them experience the world of archaeology and the history of the site by giving a hands-on relive history tour (asking them, for instance, while standing in a mudpool to whipe their feed as they were to enter the contours of a prehistoric house).

profile_positions.description: I lecture for passengers aboard small expedition cruiseships on various Arctic topics, from cartography, whaling and Inuit houses to seamounts, aurora and building challenges in cold regions. Furthermore I drive Zodiacs to shuttle passengers ashore and guide tundra walks. I also assist in wildlife watching (whales, birds and polar bears) from the ship.
profile_positions.title: Guide/Lecturer on board expeditioncruises

profile_positions.description: I develop and teach courses about privacy under the GDPR (AVG) and Data Protection Impact Assessments. I also help university staff with user support for Office applications.

profile_positions.company: University of Groningen, Faculty of Law
profile_positions.description: Working closely with informationmanagers, I retrieve information on the scientific output of members of the law faculty from various databases and report that output to the director of scientific affairs of the faculty. As a co-worker described me working: Karen combines her talents to a maximum when given a free hand, being creative and strongheaded at the same time. She likes to do things simultaneously: fullfilling her primary assignment and at the same time testing different relevant alternatives just as swift. When Karen and I once put our heads together to produce some management reports on research information at University of Groningen we had some very good laughs on top of IT.  Above that she really likes the 'monkey business' as she calls her work herself.

profile_positions.title: PhD-student

volunteer_experiences.description: Bat Squad Groningen tries to educate people about bats by education in form of lectures, excursions and social media outreach. Furthermore, we monitor the well-being of the bats in our city and province by regularly counting them (by ear with detectors in summertime and on sight while they are hibernating in objects in wintertime). And we advise the city and province councils on large building projects in or nearby bat-habitats as well as contractors on how to minimise the impact of their work on the bats, to protect the various species of bats as best as we can.
